name: stream
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: water that flows naturally along a fixed route formed by a channel cut into rock or ground, usually at ground level

example.eg: There's a bubbling stream that flows through their property.
example.egtrans: 一条汩汩的小溪流过他家的土地。

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: any current of water or liquid

example.eg: the level of cholesterol in your blood stream

trans_examp.trans_en: the direction in which water is moving

example.eg: She stopped rowing and let the boat float with the stream.
example.egtrans: 她不再划，任由小船顺流漂荡。

trans_examp.trans_en: a continuous flow of things or people

example.eg: There has been a steady stream of phone calls from worried customers.
example.egtrans: 不断有忧心忡忡的顾客打电话来。

example.eg: I had a constant stream of visitors while I was ill.
example.egtrans: 我生病时一直有人来看我。

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of school students with similar ability who are approximately the same age and are taught together
trans_examp.trans_cn: （同龄学生依照学习能力编排的）班，组

example.eg: I'm in the A stream for maths, and the B stream for English.
example.egtrans: 我数学在 A 组，英语在 B 组。

name: stream
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to flow somewhere or produce liquid, quickly and in large amounts without stopping

example.eg: There were tears streaming down his face.
One woman was carried from the scene of the accident with blood streaming from her head.
example.egtrans: 一名头部流血的妇女被从事故现场抬走了。

example.eg: I've got a terrible cold and my nose has been streaming all week.
example.egtrans: 我得了重感冒，整个星期都在流鼻涕。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to move continuously in one direction

example.eg: We were all very excited as we streamed out of our final exam.
example.egtrans: 期终考试结束后，我们涌出考场时都非常兴奋。

example.eg: Officials estimate that 20,000 refugees streamed into the city last week.
example.egtrans: 官员们估计上周有两万名难民涌入这个城。

example.eg: His hair streamed out behind him as he rode off.
example.egtrans: 他骑车离开，头发在脑后飘扬。

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to listen to or watch sound or video on a computer directly from the internet rather than downloading it and saving it first

dsense.name: stream
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to group and teach together school students with similar abilities who are approximately the same age
trans_examp.trans_cn: （把同龄学生依照学习能力）编排成班（或组）

example.eg: We start to stream the children in the third form.
example.egtrans: 我们从三年级开始把孩子们按能力分班。
